title: 35-Day Government Shutdown - Longest in U.S. History
summary: Longest shutdown in US history (35 days). 380,000 federal workers furloughed; 420,000 worked without pay. CBO estimated $11 billion loss to economy including $3 billion permanent. Started over border wall funding demand. Trump ended it after travel delays from air traffic controllers calling out sick.
keyFacts: Longest shutdown in US history (35 days) - Dec 22, 2018 to Jan 25, 2019
420,000 additional workers worked without pay - 800,000 total affected
Started over Trump's demand for border wall funding
CBO estimated $11 billion loss to economy, $3 billion permanent
Widespread travel delays from air traffic controllers calling out sick
Ended Jan 25, 2019 after mounting pressure including from his own party
Trump agreed to 3-week funding bill without border wall funds
